result.markdown:
--- title: Get Financial Data by Stock Ticker From the data.sec.gov API description: 'A notebook, with code, showing how to pull data from sec.gov web API’s' author: Scott Wied date: 11/06/2022 categories: - Pandas - API's - Matplotlib - Finance - Python image: image.png format: html: code-fold: false number-sections: true toc: true toc-location: left code-line-numbers: true execute: warning: false --- :::: {.column-page-right} ## Import python packages ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import requests import json from pprint import pprint import pandas as pd import numpy as np import re import matplotlib.pyplot as plt ``` ::: ## Parameters ::: {.cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Which company do you wish to track? ticker = 'AAPL' # An email address needs to be included in the URL of the API call email_address = 'your-email@example.com' ``` ::: ## Find the CIK number for the chosen stock ticker ### Request ticker exchange data from the sec.gov API ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Run the API request request_info = requests.get('https://sec.gov/files/company_tickers_exchange.json') # Print the returned status code (200 is good, 404 is bad) and other content info. print("Request status code:", request_info.status_code) print("Content Type:", request_info.headers['Content-Type']) print("Content Length:", request_info.headers['Content-Length'], 'bytes') ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Request status code: 200 Content Type: application/json Content Length: 214545 bytes ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Put the requested content into a Python dict object using the `.json()` method request_data = request_info.json() ``` ::: ### Explore the data that was returned ::: {.cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} # We know that request_data is a dictionary, so let's list all of its keys. print("request_data:", request_data.keys()) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` request_data: dict_keys(['fields', 'data']) ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} request_data['fields'] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=23} ``` ['cik', 'name', 'ticker', 'exchange'] ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} request_data['data'][0:10] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=24} ``` [[320193, 'Apple Inc.', 'AAPL', 'Nasdaq'], [789019, 'MICROSOFT CORP', 'MSFT', 'Nasdaq'], [1018724, 'AMAZON COM INC', 'AMZN', 'Nasdaq'], [1067983, 'BERKSHIRE HATHAWAY INC', 'BRK-B', 'NYSE'], [731766, 'UNITEDHEALTH GROUP INC', 'UNH', 'NYSE'], [34088, 'EXXON MOBIL CORP', 'XOM', 'NYSE'], [200406, 'JOHNSON & JOHNSON', 'JNJ', 'NYSE'], [104169, 'Walmart Inc.', 'WMT', 'NYSE'], [19617, 'JPMORGAN CHASE & CO', 'JPM', 'NYSE'], [93410, 'CHEVRON CORP', 'CVX', 'NYSE']] ``` ::: ::: ### Create a Pandas dataframe from the API content ::: {.cell execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Create a new dataframe df_tickers = ( pd.DataFrame(data=request_data['data'], columns=request_data['fields']) .set_index('ticker') ) # Display the top few rows df_tickers.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=25} ```{=html}
cik name exchange
ticker
AAPL 320193 Apple Inc. Nasdaq
MSFT 789019 MICROSOFT CORP Nasdaq
AMZN 1018724 AMAZON COM INC Nasdaq
BRK-B 1067983 BERKSHIRE HATHAWAY INC NYSE
UNH 731766 UNITEDHEALTH GROUP INC NYSE
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Slice the dataframe to show only the row where ticker=='AAPL' df_tickers.query(f"ticker=='{ticker}'") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=26} ```{=html}
cik name exchange
ticker
AAPL 320193 Apple Inc. Nasdaq
``` ::: ::: ### Create a function to pull data for a single ticker and format the CIK as a string This is necessary because in the next section we will need to add a formatted CID to the API call. ::: {.cell execution_count=10} ``` {.python .cell-code} def get_cik_string(ticker_data, ticker_symbol): ticker_symbol = ticker_symbol.upper() data_slice = ticker_data.loc[[ticker_symbol],['cik']] cik_value = data_slice.values[0][0] cik_string = 'CIK' + str(cik_value).rjust(10, '0') return cik_string ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=11} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Example for our ticker print("ticker:", ticker) print("CIK:", get_cik_string(df_tickers, ticker)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` ticker: AAPL CIK: CIK0000320193 ``` ::: ::: ## Get financial data from data.sec.gov api for a specific XBRL line item tag ::: {.cell execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Build up the request URL cik = get_cik_string(df_tickers, ticker) tag = 'Assets' url = f"https://data.sec.gov/api/xbrl/companyconcept/{cik}/us-gaap/{tag}.json" print("URL:", url) # Run the API request request_tag_data = requests.get(url, headers={'User-Agent': email_address}) # Print the status code (200 is good, 404 is bad), and other content info. print("Request status code:", request_tag_data.status_code) print("Content Type:", request_tag_data.headers['Content-Type']) print("Content Length:", request_tag_data.headers['Content-Length'], 'bytes') ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` URL: https://data.sec.gov/api/xbrl/companyconcept/CIK0000320193/us-gaap/Assets.json ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Request status code: 200 Content Type: application/json Content Length: 2052 bytes ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=13} ``` {.python .cell-code} tag_data = request_tag_data.json() pprint(tag_data, depth=2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` {'cik': 320193, 'description': 'Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of ' 'all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future ' 'economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a ' 'result of past transactions or events.', 'entityName': 'Apple Inc.', 'label': 'Assets', 'tag': 'Assets', 'taxonomy': 'us-gaap', 'units': {'USD': [...]}} ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=14} ``` {.python .cell-code} df_tag_data = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(tag_data['units']['USD']) ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=15} ``` {.python .cell-code} df_tag_data ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=32} ```{=html}
end val accn fy fp form filed frame

116 rows × 8 columns

``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=16} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Filter rows to only those with current year (CY) labels starts_with_cy = lambda x: bool(isinstance(re.search(r'^CY', x), re.Match)) x_axis_name = 'End Date' y_axis_name = f'{tag} (USD in Billions)' df_plot_data = ( df_tag_data .query("form == '10-Q'") .assign(yr_mon = lambda x: [f"{y[0]}-{y[1]}" for y in zip(x.fy, x.fp)] ) .assign(filter_flag = lambda x: [starts_with_cy(str(y)) for y in x.frame]) .query("filter_flag==True") .filter(['end', 'val']) .assign(val = lambda x: x.val/1000000000) .rename(columns={'end':x_axis_name, 'val':y_axis_name}) .sort_values(by=x_axis_name) ) df_plot_data.tail(10) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=33} ```{=html}
End Date Assets (USD in Billions)

114 2022-06-25 336.309
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=17} ``` {.python .cell-code} df_plot_data.plot(kind = 'bar', x = x_axis_name, y = y_axis_name, figsize=(11, 6), title = f"{ticker} {tag}") plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](stock_ticker_data_files/figure-html/cell-18-output-1.png){width=872 height=588} ::: ::: ::::
